events.message: Customer submitted initial claim after involving their car in a traffic collision with another vehicle downtown.
Claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the claim details and incident type provided.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the customer's auto accident claim and guide them through the process.
Claim acknowledgment sent to customer confirming receipt of all initial claim information and next steps.
Request sent to customer for police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed.
Customer provided full set of requested documents including police report and mechanic’s damage assessment.
Investigators began review of submitted evidence and contacted involved parties to verify claim facts.
Complete investigative report finalized showing primary fault was on the other driver, supporting claim validity.
A fair settlement offer was presented to the customer covering repair costs and temporary transportation expenses.
Customer responded expressing satisfaction with the communication and promptness of the settlement offer.
Official claim approval was granted following customer’s acceptance of settlement terms and conditions.
Issued payment electronically to customer’s bank account to cover approved repair costs promptly.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation of payment receipt by the customer.
All final documents and claim correspondence were archived securely in the company database.
